Ligarius continued in Africa, and was finally taken prisoner at Adrumetum. The clemency of Caesar spared his life, but he was sentenced to banishment. His friends, and Cicero himself, endeavored to procure his recall, but the stubborn resistance of the Pompeian party in Africa made Caesar inex· orable.
